title: Content Gaps Analysis: www.aem.live
summary: 197 indexed pages, 192 sitemap URLs. 10 pages missing from sitemap, 5 sitemap-only pages, 4 broken nav links, 65 missing OG images (33%), 72 stale pages older than 12 months (37%), 17 old branding references to "Adobe Experience Manager" instead of "AEM".

sections.label: Structural issues (sitemap gaps, broken nav links)
Content freshness analysis (stale pages by age)
Full searchable content inventory table (197 pages)

title: Action Plan: www.aem.live
summary: 18 prioritized actions derived from content gaps analysis. 4 critical, 5 high, 5 medium, 4 low priority items covering dead pages, sitemap sync, rebranding, stale content, and monitoring.

sections.label: Critical priority (4 actions): Remove dead /drafts/documentation page, Sync sitemap, Fix broken nav links, Add missing OG images
High priority (5 actions): Rebrand old AEM references, Triage 72 stale pages, Add meta descriptions, Fix sitemap-only pages, Standardize URLs
Medium priority (5 actions): Review /drafts, Audit labs content, Update deprecation notices, Consolidate duplicates, Add publication dates
Low priority (4 actions): Clean query index, Freshness monitoring, Archive obsolete content, Improve nav structure

title: Brand Guidelines Extraction: www.aem.live
summary: Comprehensive brand analysis across 10 representative pages. 4 positioning pillars, tone spectrum on 7 axes, 6 personality traits with 42 evidence quotes, terminology map, 7 documentation patterns, image quality grades (A+ infrastructure, F accessibility), visual identity extraction.

sections.label: 4 brand positioning pillars (Developer-First, Speed & Performance, Simplicity, Modern Web)

title: Improvement Opportunities: www.aem.live Brand & Docs
summary: 22 prioritized improvement opportunities across accessibility, brand consistency, documentation architecture, and image strategy. 5 critical, 6 high, 6 medium, 5 low. Impact/effort matrix with 4-sprint execution plan.

sections.label: Summary of 22 opportunities with priority breakdown
5 critical items (alt text, /developer/ 404, block docs, naming consistency, OG tags)

title: Content Readability Scoring: www.aem.live
summary: 10-page readability analysis. FK Grade range 7.8 (homepage) to 13.8 (markup docs). Avg FK Grade 10.8, avg reading ease 46.2. 86% active voice site-wide. 3 pages inaccessible to non-technical stakeholders. Brand claim "inclusive directness" partially validated — homepage delivers, developer content does not.

sections.label: Executive summary with key metrics and brand claim assessment
Comparison matrix (10 pages ranked by Flesch Reading Ease)
Individual page scorecards with FK grade, jargon, quotes

title: Traffic-Weighted Content Intelligence: www.aem.live
summary: 157K views over 10 days across 152 URLs. 94% desktop traffic. Top 10 pages = 42.6% of all traffic. Cross-references RUM telemetry with static analysis to reshuffle priorities: 5 actions upgraded, 4 downgraded, 4 new from telemetry. 31 stale pages with traffic vs 41 safe to archive. 28 CWV issues, 13.9K JS errors.

sections.label: Data source verification (RUM bundles, sampling methodology)
Device split (94% desktop) and referrer sources
Priority shift matrix (actions re-ranked by real traffic)
OG image gaps weighted by traffic

title: SEO Brand Signals: www.aem.live
summary: 8-page SEO metadata audit. All 8 pages have title/description/OG/Twitter/canonical/single-H1. All 8 missing: lang attribute, og:type, favicon link, hreflang. Only 1/8 has structured data. 3/8 have custom OG images. 7/8 titles lack brand name. Site invisible for own brand keywords in SERP.

sections.label: SEO signals scorecard (12 metrics, pass/fail grid)

title: Brand Consistency Scorecard: www.aem.live
summary: Page-level brand voice audit across 12 pages scored against 6 personality traits and 7 tone axes. Mean score 76/100. 4 strong alignment, 5 minor drift, 3 significant deviation. FAQ (58) and /business/demo (48) highest-risk. Developer pages avg 82.5 vs docs avg 72.7.

sections.label: Executive overview with mean score and distribution
Trait heatmap (6 brand traits x 12 pages)
Strong alignment tier (4 pages: keeping-it-100, tutorial, architecture, golive)
Minor drift tier (5 pages: authoring, markup, homepage, rum, sharepoint)
Significant deviation tier (3 pages: custom-headers, faq, demo)
All page scores with trait breakdown and tone positioning

title: Brand Evolution Timeline: AEM Edge Delivery Services
summary: Brand archaeology: 8 years, 6+ names. Helix (2018) to Franklin (2022) to Edge Delivery Services (Oct 2023). ~93% rebrand on aem.live but 40+ GitHub repos still helix-*. hlx.live blocked Dec 2025 (403, not 301). 13 legacy references on live site. Developer API ~30% rebranded.

sections.label: Executive summary with key naming stats
Complete name roster (6 product names with dates)
GitHub repo naming audit (40+ helix-* repos)
Legacy remnants still on live site

title: Competitor Brand Positioning Audit: www.aem.live
summary: 6-brand competitive analysis across 10 dimensions: aem.live vs Contentful, Sanity, Netlify, Vercel, WordPress VIP. aem.live owns the performance niche (unique Lighthouse 100 promise) and scores highest on educational tone (82). All competitors lead with AI messaging — aem.live does not. 4/6 are developer-first. aem.live and WP VIP hide pricing.

sections.label: Executive summary (6 brands, 10 dimensions, key findings)
Hero messaging comparison across all 6 brands
Tone of voice comparison (7 axes mapped per brand)

title: Developer Touchpoint Brand Audit: www.aem.live
summary: Audit of 5 developer touchpoints: 4 GitHub repos, 1 npm package, AGENTS.md. Overall grade B+. 67% naming consistency, 14 legacy "Helix" references. Brand voice strongest in Sidekick and AGENTS.md, weakest in CLI (repo still named helix-cli) and npm metadata. .hlxignore, window.hlx namespace persist.

sections.label: Executive summary with B+ grade, 5 touchpoints, 14 helix references
Naming consistency audit (AEM vs Helix vs Franklin per artifact)
Brand trait heatmap (6 traits x 5 touchpoints)
Overall verdict with B+ score banner

title: Image Quality & AI Improvement: www.aem.live
summary: 197 pages inventoried: 132 custom images, 65 generic fallbacks. Average brand alignment 3.6/10. 5 candidates analyzed and improved with Gemini 3 Pro — 2 pure generations, 3 improvements. Side-by-side comparisons for homepage, docs, architecture, blog, developer hub.

title: Performance Brand Validation: www.aem.live
summary: Tests the "Lighthouse 100" brand promise. Verdict: SUBSTANTIATED. CrUX field data: LCP 0.8s, INP 50ms, CLS 0.00, TTFB 0.3s. Critical path ~29 KB (under 100 KB limit). All 7 stated performance standards pass. Gap: 100% of images have empty alt="" — accessibility failures prevent true Lighthouse 100.

sections.label: Verdict (brand promise substantiated with accessibility caveat)
Core Web Vitals field data (LCP 0.8s, INP 50ms, CLS 0.00)

The accessibility gap (empty alt tags site-wide)
